Description:
The FHIR DocumentReference resource describes information about a document.

The response of a Create is the same as a Read if the user specifies that they want the whole resource returned. Otherwise, it will just return the DocumentReference FHIR ID.
SampleRequest:
<DocumentReference xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<id value="e8HqtKz52elU-DQ07nvesd2UafQLBdy8L1VhcKr-qWDU3"/>

<type>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.4.737880.5010"/>

<code value="1"/>

<display value="Progress Note"/>

</coding>

<coding>

<system value="http://loinc.org"/>

<code value="10164-2"/>

<display value="Progress Note"/>

</coding>

<text value="Progress Notes"/>

</type>

<subject>

<reference value="https://vs-icx.epic.com:443/Interconnect-CDE/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/efvHwbc1k1CQ9XjM1zvvefQ3"/>

<display value="Fhir D Cds Jr., Esq."/>

</subject>

<content>

<attachment>

<contentType value="text/plain"/>

<data value="SGVyZSBpcyBzb21lIE5vdGUgVGV4dCBpbiBoZXJlLCBlbmNvZGVkIHRvIGJhc2U2NCBmb3JtYXQuLi4="

/>

</attachment>

</content>

<context>

<encounter>

<reference value="https://vs-icx.epic.com:443/Interconnect-CDE/api/FHIR/STU3/Encounter/e1nwgHptGepfRd.CyEtC8LgkIwX39RoLdflPDeqLIA143"

/>

</encounter>

</context>

</DocumentReference>
SampleResponse:
<DocumentReference xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<id value="e1AE1NCGysUfvBQvG2rIJ90Xbo3xORooK5lceHLykX2M3"/>

<status value="current"/>

<docStatus value="final"/>

<type>

<coding>

<system value="http://loinc.org"/>

<code value="11506-3"/>

<display value="Progress Note"/>

</coding>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.4.737880.5010"/>

<code value="1"/>

<display value="Progress Notes"/>

</coding>

<text value="Progress Notes"/>

</type>

<subject>

<reference value="https://epic.com/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/efvHwbc1k1CQ9XjM1zvvefQ3"/>

<display value="Fhir D Cds Jr., Esq."/>

</subject>

<created value="2018-03-01T21:04:35Z"/>

<indexed value="2018-03-01T21:04:35Z"/>

<author>

<reference value="https://epic.com/api/FHIR/STU3/Practitioner/eA6CcVv.bIBLSIkZM-b.9Bg3"/>

<display value="Srovider, Starter"/>

</author>

<content>

<attachment>

<url value="https://epic.com/api/FHIR/STU3/Binary/eoHLRJp.lMo5.q5J5BCimj1FJ3b7tchqWgFtRWzeznkU3"

/>

</attachment>

</content>

<context>

<encounter>

<reference value="https://epic.com/api/FHIR/STU3/Encounter/eO2pW5pfb3.99TYMaBfbkykrJLqtdDEeCOPb0JMpQwJs3"

/>

</encounter>

</context>

</DocumentReference>

DocumentReference.Name: DocumentReference
DocumentReference.Description: An instance of the STU3 DocumentReference resource.

data.Name: data
data.Description: The note string to save, encoded in base64. Max character count is 32,000.

context.Name: context
context.Description: The context of the document content.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The encounter you are filing the note to. This must be a clinical encounter that can hold a note. Reference to an Encounter FHIR ID.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient you are filing the note to. Reference to a Patient FHIR ID.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
If the client knows the list of note types, they can send in the type as:

  • code= Note Type value from category list INP 5010
  • system=customer-specific oid for category list INP 5010

For example: "urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010"

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"

DocumentReference.Name: DocumentReference
DocumentReference.Description: An instance of the STU3 DocumentReference resource.

authenticator.Name: authenticator
authenticator.Description: Who or what authenticated the document.

author.Name: author
author.Description: Who or what authored the document.

url.Name: url
url.Description: The URI where the data can be found.

context.Name: context
context.Description: The context of the document content.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The context of the document content.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The note identifier from the Epic system.

indexed.Name: indexed
indexed.Description: When this document reference was created, which is the same as Created time for notes.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Status of the note. Always returns "current" for newly created notes.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient that is the subject of the note.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The note type. Can be in the format:

  • code= Note Type value from category list INP 5010
  • system=customer-specific oid for category list INP 5010
  • For example: "urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010"

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"

The following LOINC codes are supported:

  • 11506-3: Progress Note
  • 11488-4: Consult Note
  • 28570-0: Procedure Note
  • 34117-2: H&P Note
  • 18842-5: Discharge Summary
  • 34111-5: ED Note
  • 69730-0: Patient Instructions
  • 34746-8: Nursing Note
